title: What are your thoughts on Lux?
body:
Since Season 2 and picking up the game from my friends, Lux has always been my favorite champion. I really wish that I could see her played more competitively. I know and have heard all the old arguments (i.e Why play Lux when you can play Morgana?; Her skillshots are too unreliable; etc). I was just wondering you thoughts on what Riot could do to make her more viable?

Could she be a better AP Carry with better scaling?
Could she be a better support with more utility? (Blind on her Q cause idk, light blinds people).

replies.body: Mana costs are terrible for lux right now.  fixing that would certainly help.
Her main mana hog is her E and its too easy to land for any sort of buff because it she can really frustrating to lane against, but improving the rest of her kit would be nice.
if they buff the mana cost they'll nerf its reliability. I bet they'd reduce the missile speed. That seems to be the hot trend lately.

I think Lux pays too much of a power-budget price for her passive, especially since it's really clunky to fully utilize.

To maximize her damage while bursting someone, Lux (A) needs to sacrifice safety by moving in to auto-attack range, and (B) needs to weave auto-attacks into her spelll rotation (E-Q-Auto-Detonate E-Auto-R-Auto). All this while being in easy access range of the enemy team. It puts her right into assassin's claws and slows down the speed with which she can burst someone since she needs to wait for the auto-attack projectile to land and detonate her passive before she can move to the next step of the rotation, and with how mobile and fast the game is right now this gives her enemies a significant window of opportunity to escape. Lux can rapidfire E-Q-E-R to burst faster but she misses out on a sizeable chunk of damage by only getting one proc of her passive (the one triggered by R before it re-applies the passive).

I think the biggest change Lux needs is to have some damage shifted off of her passive and onto her spells. Possibly even have ALL of the damage shifted to her spells and be given a utility passive (damage amplification on targets her skills have granted her vision of, for example.)
That would be a nice change, sort of like a leona passive could work to, and I would be happy with that. If her allies can proc the passive and she can just rapid burst her combo more easily.

I feel like making it work like leona's passive would mean they both have exactly the same passive, except Luxs is better since she can self-detonate. I'd rather see Lux get an overhaul on her passive, and allow Leona to self-detonate hers (please please PLEASE Riot {{item:3070}} {{champion:89}} {{item:3070}})
I think having the damage on auto would be fine if they would speed up her auto animation.
I think Lux is in a good spot right now. Maybe it's just me, but I do feel like she can do well mid lane. She's not the strongest, but she can definitely do a good job if played well.

I find that if she just farms mid lane, other (Ahri, Leblanc, Viktor, etc) will just outscale her in damage.
If she tries to go pokey, then she goes oom fast as well as give the enemy a HUGE window to attack back since she has high CD.
She's also not exactly a kill mid laner unless you get the q down, but most of the time, your opponent will just hide behind minions.

How would you define playing mid lane well with her?

Ahri Q is on a lower cooldown, cost less mana, and can do a lot more damage when hit twice on the way back.

The problem I have with her is she's not a sustain damage mage (once you throw combo, you're stuck in a team fight for like 6 secs before you can do anything besides AA), nor is she a true burst mage. Yes, yes, yes, you you catch a squishy with a Q, blah blah blah. If the enemy tea knows how to play, their tanks will be in the front, and squishies in the back, there's really no way you locking down the Vayne, for example. Lux was the first champion I ever bought, and one of my favorites. I think she's okay right now, but has some problems that really hurt her.

1) The passive is kinda awkward to use. Champions like Kat, Zed, Yasuo, etc with punish you extremely hard for getting into AA range. Even champions like Veigar or Annie can simple through a Q your way to get a pretty even trade. My idea for a change, would be to either speed up her AA animation along with giving her a little more AA range. OR, simple add the ability to reveal any champion that has her passive on them. Another fix would be allowing any spell Lux lands also proc the damage, basically like her ult already does. This would make Lux more of a chain-burst mage that focuses on landing several spells in a sequence. 

2) Her Q does not reveal champions. For a mage that is themed around the idea of Light, it makes little sense. While champions such as Morgana can just watch the projectile and see if it disappears, Lux's can hit two targets so unless there are two people in a bush that doesn't work.

3) The shield is actually in a pretty good place, I would leave it as it is.

4) The mana cost on E is just stupid. No one has a mana cost that high without some kind of mana return.

5) Her ult is in a good spot. It does have a low cooldown with a huge range, but lower damage compared to other AP mages like Veigar and Xerath. It is one of the core parts of Lux that I would prefer stay as is.

Lux is in an interesting place right now because she’s not necessarily weak, but she isn’t exactly the strongest either. She has some pretty obvious strengths and weaknesses - amazing utility with all her CC, AoE shield, and an amazing low cooldown ult, but relatively long early cooldowns, high mana costs, highly immobile and a clunky passive.

I think the biggest issue I have with Lux is that everyone single one of her skills requires her to stop moving in order to cast and for a mage who’s already immobile in the first place, this is a huge crutch. She has no effective way of getting away and her shield is useless when she’s being chased (mostly due to the small amount it shields her, for the long time she has to stand still to cast it). Basically, she has very unreliable disengage and positioning is HUGE for her.

My other issue is with her passive is practically useless out of the laning phase. I think it should either be able to be procc’ed by allies or at least do something more, like grant true vision. She technically shouldn’t ever be in range to proc a passive with an AA in teamfights, but that’s also a huge chunk of her damage gone.

I think Lux is just in general, a little outdated. I don’t think her kit needs a rework, she just needs small tweaks like updating mana costs, etc. She’s not played as often simply because there are other champs who are so much easier to play in terms of positioning and give much less migraines when it comes to mana.

Also, support Lux has 2 issues - mana and her ult. She’s too much of a mana whore to be effective in bot lane and her ult brings no utility to the team. Her AoE shield is cool, but the 35% AP scaling isn’t all that great, especially compared to Janna’s Eye of the Storm which gives you 240 health (which is 60 health more than Lux’s) +70% AP scaling and an AD buff (or even Karma’s shield). (Yes, Lux’s shield is AoE, but we all know how our teammates all turn into Faker whenever we try to shield them.) Plus her shield is a skillshot, not instantaneous one like Janna’s or Karma’s.

Don't get me wrong on this, but I think Lux's issues isn't her mana problems, but her primary itemization paths. Right now, if you itemize the Big 3 (Ludens/Rabadons/Zhonyas) you get more power for your mana but you become blue buff intensive. If you optimize for mana regeneration, your damage suffers tremendously but you're able to get your spells off faster and sooner.

My solution is honestly just go with two Doran Rings (pretend you're Diana) and straight up grab Ludens to help your wave clear (adding 100 damage to 4 targets)

With two Dorans you gain 6 mana per 5. Which is 1.2 mana per second. At level 7, Lux naturally has 9.9 mana/5 (Essentially 2 per second) so you have 3.2 mana per second ticking during the CD of Lucent (10 seconds, which means you regenerate 3.2x10 = 32 total mana) on top of the potential to have 8x6 (sometimes 7) = 48 mana regenerated from last hitting minions with a grand total between Lucent Singularities being 130 - 80 = 50 mana used.
(NOTE this isn't taking into account the possibility of having either the Utility Tree passive 3 mana per 5 or the Offence Tree's 1 Mana per minion.)

Not to mention every 30 seconds minions spawn, so if you're just wave clearing you can keep your mana pool up and ready for skirmishes.
